description: This course is an introduction to speaking, reading, and writing Japanese; writing includes the learning of all syllabic letters (Hiragana and Katakana) and basic Kanji (Chinese characters). Class meets four times weekly. Individual language laboratory visits are also required. Prerequisite: Japanese 111 or equivalent. Offered annually in the Spring Semester.
name: Beginning Japanese II
notes: Students in Japanese 112A and B must also register for one lab Japanese 112 AL
prerequisites: Japanese 111 or equivalent. Offered annually in the Spring Semester.

revisions.prerequisites: Prerequisite: Japanese 111 or equivalent. Offered annually in the Spring Semester.
